greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) = binomial(3*n+1, 2*n+k+1), read by rows.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n=0..100 of triangle, flattened
E. H. M. Brietzke, An identity of Andrews and a new method for the Riordan array proof of combinatorial identities, Discrete Math., 308 (2008), 4246-4262.
mathematica: f[n_,k_]:=Binomial[3n+1,2n+k+1]; Table[ f[n, k], {n, 0, 9}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 31 2009 *)
program: (PARI) for(n=0,10, for(k=0,n, print1(binomial(3*n+1, 2*n+k+1), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, May 19 2018
(MAGMA) /* As triangle */ [[Binomial(3*n+1, 2*n+k+1): k in [0..n]]: n in [0..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, May 19 2018
results.author: _Philippe Deléham_, Apr 23 2009
